1:
Remember, Yahweh, what has happened to us
\q look and see our disgrace.
\q
3:
We have become orphans, the fatherless,
\q and our mothers are like widows.
\q
4:
We must pay silver for the water we drink,
\q and we must pay silver to get our own wood.
6:
We have given ourselves to Egypt and to Assyria
\q to get enough food.
\q
7:
Our fathers sinned, and they are no more,
\q and we bear their iniquities.
8:
Slaves rule over us,
\q and there is no one to deliver us from their hand.
\q
9:
We get our bread only by risking our lives,
\q because of the sword in the wilderness.
\q
10:
Our skin has grown as hot as an oven
\q because of the burning heat of hunger.
11:
Women are raped in Zion,
\q and virgins in the cities of Judah.
\q
12:
Princes are hung up by their own hands,
\q and no honor is shown to the elders.
13:
Young men are forced to grind grain with a millstone,
\q and boys stagger under heaven loads of wood.
\q
14:
The elders have left the city gate,
\q and the young men have left their music.
15:
The joy of our heart has ceased
\q and our dancing has turned into mourning.
\q
16:
The crown has fallen from our head;
\q woe to us, for we have sinned!
17:
For this our heart has become sick,
\q and our eyes have grown dim,
\q for these things our eyes grow dim
\q
18: for Mount Zion lies desolate, with jackals prowling over it.
19:
But you, Yahweh, reign forever,
\q and you will sit upon your throne from generation to generation.
\q
20:
Why do you forget us forever?
\q Why do you forsake us for so many days?
\q
21:
Restore us to yourself, Yahweh, and we will be restored.
\q Renew our days as they were long agoâ€”
\q
22:
unless you have utterly rejected us
\q and you are angry with us beyond measure.
\q
